revised_title: The Repetition of Dr. Hooke's Experiment on Two Liquors and the Phenomenon of Penetration of Dimensions
tldr: The author, F. Hauksbee, repeats Dr. Hooke's experiment involving two liquors that possess less space when mixed together. Hauksbee observes a decrease in the surface height of the mixed liquors and discusses the possible causes, such as evaporation or a change in the dimensions of the substances.
